knimeNode.name: FTP Connector (Labs)
knimeNode.shortDescription: Connects to remote file system via FTP in order to read/write files in downstream nodes.

intro.p: This node connects to a remote FTP server. The resulting output port allows downstream nodes to access the files of the remote server, e.g. to read or write, or to perform other file system operations (browse/list files, copy, move, ...).

Path syntax: Paths for FTP are specified with a UNIX-like syntax such as /myfolder/myfile. An absolute path for FTP consists of:
A leading slash ("/").
Followed by the path to the file ("myfolder/myfile" in the above example).

tab.name: Settings
tab.option: Address of the host where the FTP server runs.
Port that the FTP server is listening on for incoming connections.

Method of authentication to use.
Credentials: Authenticate with the username and password of the selected credentials flow variable.
Username/password: Authenticate with the provided Username and Password. The password is persistently stored (in encrypted form) in the settings of this node. The password may be empty if the SSH server permits empty passwords.
Anonymous: Authenticate with the anonymous user name and blank password.

Specify the working directory of the resulting file system connection, using the Path syntax explained above. The working directory must be specified as an absolute path. A working directory allows downstream nodes to access files/folders using relative paths, i.e. paths that do not have a leading slash. The default working directory is the root "/".

tab.name: Advanced
tab.option: Timeout in seconds to establish a connection or 0 for an infinite timeout.
Server time zone offset from Greenwich Mean Time (minutes).
Minimal number of connected and logged in FTP clients in resource pool the node will try to open. Actual number of connections may be less, depending on the limits of the FTP server.
Maximum possible FTP clients in pool size.
The number of seconds which FTP client can be inactive before close if the number of clients in pool is more then minimum pool size.
If this options selected, then FTPS protocol with explicit mode and TLS will used for connection.
If this options selected, then configured HTTP Proxy from global Eclipse preferences will used for connection. This option is incompatible with 'Use SSL'.
